page.title: 04Trout Fishing Lparish
page.content:
Trout Fishing L.parish
The{trout}feeds mainly on flies, particularly the{Mayfly}which breeds in the mud of the river.Some eggs are taken to stretches of the river where Mayflies are known to be less numerous.Fishermen pay the owner to fish.Costs vary according to the location.To fish in our D.Block this year from 1st May to 1st Oct would cost Â£1100 + 15% V.A.T.This is for 1 day a week and the fisherman may take no more than 4 trout.The heaviest brown trout caught in the D.Block was thought to be 8 & a half lbs. Regular fishermen apply to the landowner for permission.Casual visitors to the area apply through an agency in Winchester. Tourists, mainly Americans, frequently take the opportunity to fish for trout in the {River Test}.
